abstract: Stock prices tumbled on Thursday, with most of the declines coming late in the day, led by a drop in banking and technology shares.
snippet: Stock prices tumbled on Thursday, with most of the declines coming late in the day, led by a drop in banking and technology shares.
lead_paragraph: Stock prices tumbled on Thursday, with most of the declines coming late in the day, led by a drop in banking and technology shares.

headline.main: Euro Sags and Markets Turn Lower

abstract: A distress sale that took place at Phillips de Pury, the third-place auction house, on Thursday night was a reminder that, despite some recent strong showings, in the art world the ghosts of the recession have not yet been fully exorcised.
snippet: A distress sale that took place at Phillips de Pury, the third-place auction house, on Thursday night was a reminder that, despite some recent strong showings, in the art world the ghosts of the recession have not yet been fully exorcised.
lead_paragraph: After watching millions and millions of dollars being casually spent on Warhols and Rauschenbergs, Picassos, Calders and Johnses at the spring art auctions of the last two weeks, it might seem that the money troubles of the recent past were little more than a bad dream. But a distress sale that took place at Phillips de Pury, the third-place auction house, on Thursday night was a reminder that the ghosts of the recession have not been fully exorcised, The New York Times’s Carol Vogel writes.

headline.main: Art Auction Highlights a Financial Downfall

abstract: Goldman Sachs has agreed to invest $20 million in ShoreBank, a Chicago bank which aims to expand lending in poor communities, in an effort to help keep the bank from falling into the hands of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp., The Wall Street Journal reported.
snippet: Goldman Sachs has agreed to invest $20 million in ShoreBank, a Chicago bank which aims to expand lending in poor communities, in an effort to help keep the bank from falling into the hands of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp., The Wall Street Jo...
lead_paragraph: Goldman Sachs has agreed to invest $20 million in ShoreBank, a Chicago bank that aims to expand lending in poor communities, in an effort to help keep the bank from being seized by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, The Wall Street Journal reported, citing people familiar with the situation.

headline.main: Changing the Narrative: Goldman Helps Illinois Bank
